content: >**sign up for the knitosophy newsletter 1 to receive the greatest discounts right in your inbox ** as with all my previous patterns i designed this one because i could not find a pattern that i liked for the yarn and style that i wanted this simple hat makes good use of mini sock skeins or sock yarn leftovers i have made two versions of this pattern the first original version uses a set of mini skeins which is how havirland yarns used to sell the cupid s mix kit the second version uses the newer cupid s mix frankensocks kit which is comprised of 20 mini bobbins of yarn for both patterns row of color are alternated to gradually fade from one to the next and three different colors are used at a time for each pattern repeat as demonstrated in the charts provided i love the artistic and busy but not too busy look of this beanie create a color scheme you enjoy and watch the magic unfold please note the sizes run a bit big for slouchiness so if you are unsure go down a size for the mini skein version my daughter is shown wearing size large for the mini bobbin version she is wearing size medium the large fit my husband perfectly and his head circumference is 21 5 **sizing** newborn 6 mos 6-12 mos toddler small medium large x-large please note the sizes run a bit big for added slouchiness so if you are unsure go down a size for the mini skein version my daughter is shown wearing size large for the mini bobbin version she is wearing size medium the large fit my husband perfectly and his head circumference is 21 5 **gauge** 30 sts = 4 inches **needles** 16 circulars size 2 16 circulars size 1 set of dpn s size 2 or 32 or greater circulars for magic loop **notions** stitch marker and darning needle for weaving in ends **yarn** 100-250 yds fingering weight yarn in 3 or more colors excludes pompom shown in havirland yarns cupid s mix mini skeins 10g/skein 2016 and mini bobbins 5g/bobbin 1 https //sibforms
